result.title: GlobalFoundries poised for cyclical recovery, share gains amid US onshoring push
result.text: GlobalFoundries Inc (NASDAQ:GFS) is entering a period of accelerating momentum as it benefits from a cyclical recovery, US manufacturing onshoring, and growing demand for differentiated semiconductor technologies, according to Baird analysts. Following the company's Q3 earnings, the analysts maintained their Outperform' rating on GlobalFoundries with a $40 price target, citing the company's strong positioning at the intersection of several key secular trends, notably USonshoring and the rebuild of US-based semiconductor manufacturing capacity, along with the ramp of differentiated technologies serving higher-margin platforms including AI-driven optical networking.

result.title: GlobalFoundries Downgrade: Strong Cash, Weak Growth, Tough Timing
result.text: GlobalFoundries Inc. remains strategically important in silicon photonics, SATCOM, and domestic chip manufacturing, benefiting from supply chain shifts and regulatory trends. GFS delivered solid financials: $1.69B revenue, 26% gross margin, $232M net income, and strong free cash flow, but near-term growth is soft. Valuation appears inexpensive on EV/EBITDA and price-to-cash-flow, with low leverage, yet the stock trades above its earnings-based fair value.

result.title: GlobalFoundries finance chief John Hollister departs, Sam Franklin named interim CFO
result.text: GlobalFoundries' John Hollister has stepped down from the CFO position and will be succeeded by Sam Franklin on an interim basis, the contract chipmaker said on Monday.

result.title: GlobalFoundries Announces Chief Financial Officer Transition
result.text: MALTA, N.Y., Oct. 27, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- GlobalFoundries (NASDAQ: GFS) (GF) today announced that, effectively immediately, John Hollister, GF's Chief Financial Officer, is leaving the company for personal reasons. Sam Franklin, GF's Senior Vice President of Business Finance, Operations and Investor Relations, will assume the position of Interim Chief Financial Officer while the company conducts a search for a permanent CFO.

result.title: GlobalFoundries: Positioned To Capitalize On Its China-For-China Strategy
result.text: I rate GlobalFoundries Inc. (GFS) a Buy due to its strong cash generation, China-for-China strategy, specialty foundry focus, and growing high-margin segments. GFS benefits from diversified manufacturing across the US, Europe, Singapore, and China, providing resilience against trade tensions and regional risks. Key growth drivers include the China-for-China model, MIPS acquisition for RISC-V technology, and rapid expansion in silicon photonics for data centers.

result.title: Why GlobalFoundries Just Became a Geopolitical Power Play
result.text: A renewed focus in Washington on securing America's domestic manufacturing base has sent a powerful jolt through financial markets. Investors, increasingly aligning their capital with national strategic priorities, appear to have coalesced around a key U.S.-based semiconductor manufacturer.

result.title: Slowly But Surely, Things Are Turning Positive For GlobalFoundries
result.text: GlobalFoundries remains a buy, offering steady growth, consistent earnings beats, and attractive valuation versus sector peers. GFS benefits from strong automotive and communications segments, improved balance sheet, and lower price/book and forward P/E than the sector median. Potential US chip import tariffs could favor GFS due to its substantial domestic production, though macro risks from tariffs remain.
